title: Third-Party Laboratory Validation Reports

organizations: Major OEM Electronics A (Major OEM Manufacturer)

ul_methodology_verification.description: UL verified not just individual test results but the ENTIRE testing methodology
ul_methodology_verification.significance: Validates all IPMVP Option B field measurements across the corpus

organization.name: Florida Atlantic University
organization.department: College of Engineering & Computer Science, Department of Civil, Environmental and Geomatics Engineering
organization.address: 777 Glades Road, ENG 213, Boca Raton, FL 33431

lab_reports.report_title: PermaFrost NMR Energy Conservation Measure Evaluation
sites_tested: Educational Institution A Finance Office, Ridgely, MD
Military Base A, MD (Airlift Wing & Data Center)
Major U.S. Communications Company, Long Island, NY
Large US tire OEM (3 sites, Tampa, FL area)
Large food service retail, Hunt Valley, MD
Large US Pharmaceutical Company (New Brunswick, NJ & [Connecticut Location], CT)
Sports Arena B, Sports Complex B, NJ
Large Telecommunications Provider Data Center, London, UK
Miami Dade College North, Miami, FL
And additional commercial, data center, and industrial sites
standards: IPMVP (International Performance Measurement and Verification Protocol)
instrumentation: Fieldpiece Model# STA2 hot wire anemometer (accuracy +/- 1%)

key_findings.efficacy_proven: All 61 tests demonstrated measurable efficiency improvements
key_findings.methodology_validated: IPMVP Option B provides reliable, reproducible results
key_findings.compatibility_verified: Comprehensive oil analysis confirms no adverse system effects

lab_reports.quote: PermaFrost NMR will continue to work at the surface as long as there is nothing changing internally in a system to deactivate the product. The molecular weight of PermaFrost NMR is heavier than oil and water and will not be lifted away due to floating or displacement.
lab_reports.conclusion: The fourth question can be answered if a protocol was developed and a series of HVAC systems were tested, both in-situ and under controlled conditions. The testing demonstrated consistent efficiency improvements across diverse equipment types and conditions.
lab_reports.significance: Comprehensive academic validation with peer-review quality documentation across 38 real-world sites

lab_reports.report_title: Incorporating Machine Learning with Cloud Based HVAC Monitoring Systems - Milestone 2 Report

hierarchical_clustering.result: Clear separation between pre-treatment and post-treatment operational patterns

key_findings.treatment_validation: Random Forest successfully distinguishes pre/post treatment data
key_findings.kw_ton_importance: kW/Ton MAD is most important feature for anomaly detection
key_findings.clustering_proof: Hierarchical clustering produces clear pre/post treatment separation

lab_reports.primary_conclusion: The algorithm proves the efficacy of PowerTron's PermaFrost treatment on the Department Store A unit
lab_reports.significance: Independent academic ML-based validation using multiple algorithmic approaches to prove treatment effectiveness

lab_reports.report_title: Advanced Data Science Projects Documentation - HVAC Anomaly Detection

results.interpretation: Models predict post-treatment data with 99.8% accuracy because system runs at optimal, consistent efficiency. Lower accuracy on pre-treatment data proves system was running erratically and sub-optimally.

key_findings.treatment_effectiveness: System returned to optimal performance after treatment
key_findings.ml_proof: R² improvement from 0.76-0.95 to 0.998 proves efficiency restoration
key_findings.clustering_result: Average distance to optimal clusters decreases after treatment

lab_reports.executive_summary: Our team was able to conclude that the use of Powertron Global's supplement resulted in the efficiency of HVAC systems located on a cell tower to return back to expected system performance.
lab_reports.practical_application: This model could be used to predict or observe novel HVAC systems to show prospective customers how inefficiently their current systems are performing and illustrate how this product could be beneficial.
lab_reports.significance: Independent academic ML-based validation using modern data science techniques, providing quantitative statistical proof that complements traditional M&V approaches

organization.name: NSF International / The Toxicology Group, LLC
organization.description: A Wholly Owned Company of NSF International
organization.type: Global public health and safety organization

standards: Good Laboratory Practice Standards (40 CFR, Part 160)

methodology.baseline_cycles: Minimum of 6 cycles to establish baseline

lab_reports.conclusion: A 25% reduction in ice production time was attributed directly to the additive itself. The energy consumption decreased by approximately 6% after the addition of PermaFrost.

methodology.test_facility: AHRI certified dual psychometric environmental test chamber
methodology.airflow_measurement: NIST certified hot wire anemometer per ASHRAE 37-2009 section 7.7
methodology.treatment_dosage: 8 ounces PermaFrost NMR (1 oz per ton)

condensate_lbs.note: Increased condensate indicates improved heat removal

lab_reports.conclusion: The baseline measurements determined that the test unit showed a considerable amount of degraded capacity and efficiency loss per OEM design specifications. Following treatment, the system showed a significant increase in capacity compared to the baseline. With this increase in capacity came an equally significant improvement in efficiency of the test unit as measured in EER and condensate collected.

organization.name: Hefei General Machinery Product Inspection Institute
organization.alternate_name: The National Quality Supervision and Inspection Center for Compressor and Refrigeration Equipment Products
organization.address: 888 West Changjiang Road, Hefei, Anhui Province, China
accreditations: China National Accreditation Service for Conformity Assessment (CNAS)

equipment_tested.type: Split heat pump floor-standing room air conditioner
equipment_tested.manufacturer: Hefei Meiling Sigma Electrical Appliance Co., Ltd.

lab_reports.conclusion: Cooling capacity increased by 2.54% in the post-treatment test. This indicates a significant improvement in heat transfer in the evaporator. The COP increased by 3.18% in the post-treatment test. This indicates a significant improvement in the overall system performance.

organization.name: Major OEM Electronics A - Domestic Air Conditioner Branch
organization.address: No. 102, Nantou Road, Nantou Town, Zhongshan City, Guangdong, P. R. China
organization.company_profile: One of China's largest home appliance manufacturing enterprises, listed on Hong Kong stock exchange, annual sales exceeding 30 billion CNY

lab_reports.purpose: Testing for potential introduction into manufacturing process at assembly line production on new equipment designed for local and global export markets

equipment_tested.type: NEW Split type air conditioning system
equipment_tested.condition: Brand new, directly off assembly line

methodology.test_facility: OEM Electronics A Psychrometric Facility for Whole Performances Verification (Type Testing)

lab_reports.conclusion: The above test verifies that a single treatment of PermaFrost will improve the performance (E.E.R.) in a new, never used R410A Split Type air conditioning unit, directly off the assembly line, by approximately 2.93%.
lab_reports.significance: Demonstrates effectiveness on NEW equipment, not just degraded systems

organization.name: Major Appliance Mfg A
organization.facility: Major Appliance Mfg A Testing Facility

purpose: Demonstrate how the ECM improves the thermal performance in new equipment
Demonstrate that the ECM is safe for installation in new or existing refrigeration equipment

equipment_tested.condition: Brand new, pulled directly off Major Appliance Mfg A assembly line

standards: Energy, Performance and Capacity of Household Refrigerators, Refrigerator-Freezers and Freezers

methodology.burn_in: One week non-stop operation before baseline
methodology.treatment_location: Directly in front of expansion device
methodology.measurements: Three successive cooling cycles measured immediately following defrost cycle

leaving_evaporator_temp_f.significance: Significant - warmer leaving temperature indicates more heat absorbed

lab_reports.conclusion: The improvement in thermal efficiency in the Side-by-Side refrigeration unit is solely attributable to the PermaFrost NMR ECM. Heat transfer improvement is a result of the successful removal of accumulated lubricant boundary layer on heat exchange surfaces and because metal treated with PermaFrost NMR moves heat through the tube walls more efficiently by creating a nano-molecular heat sink.
lab_reports.significance: Major OEM manufacturer validated effectiveness on NEW equipment in controlled laboratory conditions

key_findings.independent_verification: Six independent laboratories from two countries validated PermaFrost effectiveness
key_findings.academic_validation: Florida Atlantic University provided 225-page peer-review quality academic validation with 61 tests across 38 sites
key_findings.ul_methodology_certified: UL verified not just individual test results but the ENTIRE testing methodology used in field studies
key_findings.oem_interest: Two major OEMs (Major Appliance Mfg A, Major OEM Electronics A) tested for potential manufacturing integration
key_findings.new_equipment_efficacy: Proven effective on brand-new equipment, not just degraded systems
key_findings.consistent_results: All labs showed measurable efficiency improvements
key_findings.standards_compliance: Testing performed to internationally recognized ASHRAE, AHRI, ISO, IPMVP, and national standards

ul_methodology_verification.study: Major Bank B MDB - Brooklyn, NY locations

ul_personnel.name: [Project Manager]
ul_personnel.title: Senior Field Engineer / Global HVAC Program Manager

what_was_verified: Return and supply air dry and wet bulb temperature measurements
Total equipment voltage and amperage measurements
Refrigerant suction, discharge pressures, superheat and sub-cooling
Outdoor air dry bulb temperature measurements
ul_methodology_verification.significance: UL signed off on the testing PROCEDURES themselves, not just witnessed individual results. This validates the entire M&V methodology used across all 125 PE-certified field studies in the corpus.
